ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class taught me about the intricacies of internet markets and how they're different from traditional economics models. The course was well-organized for student learning and had us talk about highly relevant tech companies and the difficulties regulators face in constructing policy to ensure consumer welfare is maximized.

Learned about  how the internet has transformed so many different aspects of so many different economic marketplaces. I understood the intricacies of new internet companies, as well as how the internet has created novel business practices.
Great Professor! Class was interactive and covered an enjoyable set of topics.
Understanding of how the internet developed markets on both the global and local level
How to analyze economic papers and relate them to concepts related to internet markets
Learnt about economics of internet markets
I learned about the impact of internet markets on modern society

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class was really approachable in topic and highly relevant. It's clear that Hodgson has a deep passion for the topic and is very knowledgeable about all things internet markets related. I think the class did have trouble engaging some of my peers but that might be because it's a senior seminar so it's the fault of students rather than the professor, who seemed like he was well-meaning and wanted more participation from us

Instead of having three big p-sets, I would recommend a less math based focus and more on reading responses and understanding the concepts of the readings assigned, rather than applying what felt like over intricate mathematics, at times.
Professor was well organized and commanded a comprehensive understanding of the subject matter
The policy debates were very interesting

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Highly recommend this as a senior seminar! Very chill and the topic is interesting and approachable for students of all backgrounds
If they are interested by how the internet has changed the economic landscape, I highly recommend this class, however they should know that it does include a fair bit of math.
Yes, very relevant for any student interested in markets
Yes! You learn a lot in a low pressure environment. The final paper helps you reflect and tie the whole class together
Yes, if you are interested in learning about the economics of internet markets
Yes, easy senior Econ seminar that doesnt require a ton of work
